intro: Godetia blasdalei, commonly known as the Blasdale's godetia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent dark veins, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
